Reviews.Content: Great Stay We had an upper floor suite overlooking the river. The room was large, quiet and well apportioned with flatscreen tv's and a jacuzzi. The property is located on the hill across the river from the main tourist sites. Overall, the hotel service was superb. They offer free shuttle rides in the daytime hours between the city and the property. Staff are there to help you and remember your name. On breakfast, the buffet was plentiful and the conservatory where served beautiful. Fresh orange juice, multiple choices for eggs, pancakes, bakery items, etc. Yes, the price is 50 Euro for two. The restaurant is in the lower level of the property and is very small. Seats are well spaced, and table size comfortable. Ask the chef for the relais menus as they are not on the carte. You have the choice of meat or fish and 5/10 courses and can mix match. The wine list is well chosen and Tuscan oriented as expected.Rail Italia had a stricke the day we arrived from Rome so we drove to Florence. The hotel arranged our pick-up and took care of everything for us. Our Uffizzi tickets were waiting for us. Front desk service is truly outstanding. There are no local dining options within 5 minute walking distance that are not bus tourist stands. So if you want to eat in city center, walk down the hill and cab back if you have a hearty dinner. All-in-all a wonderful stay.
Reviews.Author: Ralff

Reviews.Content: Disappointed On a luxurious two week tour of Italy, Villa La Vedetta is the third hotel we have stayed at. Upon being driven up to the villa we were pleasantly surprised by the loveliness of the villa and the view of Florence. However everything afterward was disappointing. The room (although we booked in the spring) was not overlooking Florence but instead the gardens which were nice, but not the view we paid for. The room we were given was small and outside of the elevator so quite noisy at times. Since the hotel is outside of the city there is nothing really close by (walking distance) so it seems we were taken advantage of with absurdly high prices: 238 euros for a dinner and 50 euros for two for breakfast which seemed to consist of the same stale breads and cakes every morning. At one breakfast I actually saw one couple turn away an order of poached eggs only to have the same eggs brought out to me. When I said they were cold the waiter brought them to the kitchen, warmed them up and brought them back out! NOT the way a five star hotel should operate. I agree with another person who signed their guestbook: Save your money, stay somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: BeauConnecticut

Reviews.Content: Outstanding! We had our wedding reception at this hotel and it was fantastic. The hotel is a gem set in a pretty garden in a lovely quiet location away from all the hustle and bustle with breathtaking views of the city but just a 10-15 minute walk to the centre and main attractions. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the food was wonderful and the room was beautiful with an amazing view of Florence. We found something really special at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: ChezBlack

Reviews.Content: Hotel with a view Villa la Vedetta has one of the most beautiful hotel views I have ever seen. To sit on the terrace looking out over the roof tops of Florence was magical both by day and night. We had a lovely stay in this small but well appointed hotel. The pool area had plenty of chairs and a shady bar area and breakfast served on the terrace was well thought. My one criticism would be the restaurant, where the food is very ornate. We tried twice to order lamb but was told it was not available however ,we were given a free dessert the second time by way of an apology. The bar menu is not very inspiring so if you do not want a full dining experience every night you are better off going out to eat. Over all a great place for a few nights, you can see hectic, busy , Florence by day and retreat to hotel above it all when you have had enough.
Reviews.Author: Lulurose3

Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel I took my Mum here for her 60th birthday present. We stayed 5 nights and thought the hotel was marvellous. The staff were extremely helpful but not at all intrusive 鈥?they even left a cake in our room for Mum鈥檚 birthday. Our room was huge, and we had fabulous views from 3 windows over Florence. Breakfast was excellent 鈥?we didn鈥檛 have an evening meal here because the menu definitely didn鈥檛 cater for vegetarians, but we found plenty of places to eat in the centre, and also a pizzeria a short stroll up the road.The hotel is set up above the town which is lovely because it was quiet, but the walk back up is quite strenuous (we did it once and then just used the shuttle or a taxi).The pool was fantastic with plenty of comfortable sun loungers, and we often had it to ourselves. (We didn鈥檛 find it too cold to swim in, as a previous review stated, and we are lightweight southerners!)We thought Florence was beautiful, don鈥檛 miss David at the Galleria Academia. Ask the hotel to pre book your tickets to here and the Uffizi, it saved hours of queueing. Call them before you arrive in Florence if you can. We asked on Day 1 of our 5 day stay and only just managed to get a slot at the Galleria. It costs extra, and you need to pay the hotel in cash, but it鈥檚 worth it.Definitely a place for romantic strolls 鈥?next time I鈥檒l take my husband, and I would definitely return to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Mrs_ESussex

Reviews.Content: Perfect Getaway Absolutely amazing! Since we were celebrating a special anniversary we were upgradet to a suite. This luxury deluxe suite with view of Florence was confortable, spacious and very well appointed. The marble bathroom was amazingly roomy with deep Jacuzzi tub.The service was courteous and professional and they treated us as if we were the most important guest they had.You couldn't choose a better hotel.
Reviews.Author: MichaelNY

Reviews.Content: The real place to be We are still travelling around europe and are visiting many hotels....but we really miss La Vedetta. It has been so far the best hotel we hqve ever stayed in.. the location is simply breathtaking and the staff is beyond your expectations. When you arrive a friendly smile will always be there greeting you and then they will just greet you as if you were at your best friend's home. It's just that you really feel well? Also a visit to the restaurant; although a bit pricy, is definitely worth the experience...Thanks to the staff and the manager for the great stay. We will recommend it to all our friends and will sure come back.
Reviews.Author: jchris67

Reviews.Content: absolutely unique I think that after having visited hundreds of hotels all around the world this beats them all....besides the position which is absolutely unique, you get to see all Firenze from the hotel, the service, the staff and the restaurant are way over the top.We will definitely be back soon.
Reviews.Author: Kelly69nyc

Reviews.Content: Disappointing Whilst the views were phenomenal, our stay in this hotel was marred by the fact that our room smelt of raw sewerage and the shower would not drain causing our bedroom to flood.They were VERY reluctant to relocate us, instead promising that they would have maintenance look at the issue. I'm not convinced if anyone actually did anything other than add a few more scented sticks to the room. When we arrived back late from our days touring, the room odour was very bad. Again the following morning we complained after enduring the flooding again - I had to insist that they changed our room OR found us another hotel.Whilst the staff are friendly they tend to be very ineffectual. The next room we were given was in the main building which was better, though looking a little tired. Its a great location for the view BUT if you're wanting to explore the centre of florence then you'd be a lot better located in the centre. This hotel is a litle cut off from town and restaurants/bars are very limited.
Reviews.Author: Matt_Yorkshire

Reviews.Content: Stayed for our Florence Wedding We stayed at La Vedetta during our Florence wedding and honeymoon in Sept '06 and simply loved it! The views were spectacular and so were the grounds. The staff was super friendly, the room was outstanding and clean. We had dinner that was truly art.
Reviews.Author: sebibond1

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Friendly Staff It would be worth considering this hotel for the panoramic views alone. Outside the hotel grounds are extensive and lovely while inside the rooms are beautiful - both bedrooms and public areas. The best thing is the service which makes this hotel truly special. This was more than excellent - from the moment we arrived all of the staff knew who we were and genuinely cared about making things perfect - a friendly personal touch that made our stay wonderful, larger hotels try but never quite get it.I have stayed in a few good hotels but this was the best I have stayed in. Its informal, friendly luxury at its best!
Reviews.Author: miao-miao-miao

Reviews.Content: A very romantic experience My wife and I stayed here for our heneymoon. After looking into a number of hotels, we decided to try something with a little more modern chic and elegant touch. The rooms were simply luxurious; bed, towels, accessories were all excellent and we could have a complete view of the city....that's so romantic, above all in the evening!!!!we also had a dinner in hotel restaurant: they offered a good a la carte choice. Breakfast was well presented with a huge selection of cakes, patriesThe fresh garden made us feel relaxedHighly recommend it!
Reviews.Author: bobby63Wellington

Reviews.Content: dissapointment       adjacent caravan site
Reviews.Author: travellinggeordie

Reviews.Content: worth it! we spent two weeks in Europe for a fall break and through all the hotels we stayed in this hotel was among the best. On the arrival day it was my wife's birthday and they put a special gift in the room when we arrived. Plus we tried the fabulous Onice restaurant - by the way worth it!!!! - and the chef came out with a birthday cake and all the staff gathered around us and it was really a nice suprise! the staff was always very kind. I must say that the standard rooms are not that huge, so would reccomend to book at least a deluxe room. But still the room was very clean and Firenze is amazing!!!! Absolutely worth every eurocent we spent!!!! Will go back again!
Reviews.Author: kenny72

Reviews.Content: Enjoyable Stay We stayed at Villa La Vedetta for a couple of nights in October. We chosen Villa La Vedetta becuase my husband discovered this beautiful villa into a brochure of Italian luxury hotels and we very appreciated this oasis of luxury, comfort and graciousness. The reception staff was extremely helpful and efficient and served us with a genuine smile as if we were the only guests in the hotel. The room assigned us was......... wonderful!! Very high ceilings and beautiful furniture and fabrics. The view on the exclusive garden was terrific! Furthemore, my husband has really appreciated the free wi-fi connection: he worked with his laptop in an elegant living room with fireplace! The first night we had dinner at Onice, the restaurant inside the hotel. It is top-notch and the courses was the best food we had in Italy. The restaurant has a Michelin Star, so you do pay for the quality!!Thanks Villa La Vedetta for making our stay so enjoyable!
Reviews.Author: LuiseSantini

Reviews.Content: Amazing! Stayed here for our wedding 9/2/07 - 9/5/07 -- the ceremony, the room, the food, EVERYTHING was incredible!! We couldn't have asked for it to be more perfect. We would definitely go back! Love the location (not a bad walk at all to the city center, if you don't mind the walk uphill on the way back), the view from the hotel is incredible, and it is nice  quiet, very relaxing. The event coordinator, Carolina, is the BEST!! She handled everything for the wedding superbly. We absolutely loved Florence and this hotel!!
Reviews.Author: luttmabdba

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Gem in Florence We stayed at La Vedetta for three nights and found it absolutely wonderful. The pool area was so relaxing, (especially on a hot summers day after shopping), the staff were excellent and great with our 3 year old, the restuarant is extremely good - but it is expensive (a Michelin Star from memory) - but just up the road are casual pizza places in the Plaza overlooking the city - the views from the hotel terraces and pool are stunning. And the room was also great. Promixity to the city was fine as the hotel shuttle service dropped us off and picked us up when we called. Would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: JJSydney

Reviews.Content: significant failings Renovated villa with wonderful views over Florence. Our room in annex was smelly especially after rain. This was partially remedied by the application of deodorising tablets into the drain. There were deliberately no sink plugs to avoid overfilling sinks from the automatic taps; the management eventually agreed to supply the plugs from a local shop. The bath/shower surrounds were less than spruce and modern. Pool had to be cleared in the evening to avoid upsetting diners in the adjacent restaurant area. Dining area expensive and menu precious hence relatively few diners. Service around the pool was indifferent. Shuttle service was operated on a demand basis although hours of operation were rather limited. Breakfasts were limited and of poor quality; I thought the croissants were stale but the attending staff were not interested. Despite the small hotel size and exclusive scale tariffs, there was no senior management introduction and any sense of hospitality; merely dressing relatively inexperienced staff in some form of uniform is not good enough. This could be fabulous in every sense but at the moment it seems to be a lost opportunity.
Reviews.Author: Bertiedog

Reviews.Content: Fabulous location I booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I was a little worried that the hotel would be too far from the centre but in fact the location coudln't be better. I stayed for just one night on our way down to the Amalfi coast with my husband and 2 children but would definitely like to return. This is a really chic hotel with stunning views over Florence and it only takes 5 minutes by car to get into town. We had two beautiful and very quiet rooms overlooking the garden. We had a quick lunch at the hotel and the food seemed to be excellent - I regret not having had dinner in their restaurant. A special mention for breakfast on the terrace - great buffet and great view, really enjoyable. The hotel also has a beautiful pool with a little bar from which you can also admire the view over Firenze.
Reviews.Author: Joanna-Z

Reviews.Content: We loved the Villa La Vedetta! We loved this place. The staff was amazing, so friendly and extremely helpful. The grounds are beautiful and we had a wonderful suite. Breakfast was excellent. The cold foods were buffet style and you ordered your hot food so that it arrived to the table fresh out of the kitchen. We will definitely visit again.
Reviews.Author: operakids

Reviews.Content: Best Hotel Experience in Firenze Firenze is my favorite city in the world and I had been trying to take my wife for about 7 years. On our recent trip we planned for 3 nights there at the Grand Hotel Minerva.The Grand Hotel Minerva is a very nice hotel with a great location on the Piazza di Santa Maria Novella and a wonderful rooftop pool offering a great view of the Doumo and beyond. The only temporary problem is the work being done tearing up and replacing the Piazza on which it sits. Construction should be finished by end of summer according to the Minerva.After two nights of sleep being interrupted around 6:00 AM with jackhammer work, the manager there arranged for our transfer to this hotel. Villa La Vedetta is one of the most beautiful boutique hotels I have visited. It has the most beautiful views of Firenze that a hotel can offer. The views are from the Pool bar, the pool, the patio, the restuarant and the rooms. The service was tremendous.It saved Firenze for us and was one of the high points of the entire Italy trip.
Reviews.Author: pistol69

Reviews.Content: Fantastic view! We had a beautiful suite in a lovely setting with a fantastic view! The staff were superb! However, these attributes were somewhat offset by the sporadic air conditioning and the uncomfortable mattress. And while we thought that the breakfast buffet was very good, we thought that it should have been included in the rate.
Reviews.Author: NSOmaha

Reviews.Content: Splendid Location Staff and Service We picked this hotel for our Honeymoon and everything exceeded our expectations in every way. Our room was out of this world, it had a superb bed and lounge area with a huge balcony over the gardens, not that we needed then we had to flat screen tvs and fun wardrobes!! The staff could not do enough. The pool and views superb although service in that area could of been better. The Restaurant was faultless, expensive but worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: Whizzmethere

Reviews.Content: my favourite       looking back at hotel area from Piazza Michelangelo
Reviews.Author: whereyougoingnext

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in Feb this year for a romantic getaway for our birthdays and valentines day.Upon arrival we were sat down and given a complimentary drink while we were checked in. The staff were really great they even gave us a map of the city and circled points of interest on it for us while we were sat down.The hotel i stunning and the grounds are beautiful. The hotel has the most amazing view over Florence from the terrace, unfortunately the outdoor pool and jacuzzi weren't on but it was Feb! The weather rained on the first night, and the hotel gave us an umbrella, but was sunny after that.The rooms was a decent size but the bathrooms were great! The jacuzzi bath tub was a treat! The room was kept very clean and was tuned down at night which was nice.The mini bars are expensive as is the in house restaurant and bar so we asked reception to recommend a restaurant in the city to try and they happily obliged.There is a bus stop outside the hotel to go into the city or a taxi costs about 15 euros. You can walk but it takes a while an the walk down the hill could be a bit steep if you are not a strong walker.Florence itself is beautiful and I would definitely return to the Villa La Vedetta.
Reviews.Author: umbradley

Reviews.Content: The pearl of Florence We stayed for 4 days at Villa La Vedetta this Easter. My husband, our 10-year old daughter and me enjoyed every minute of our trip. The hotel is a charming and cosy villa with approximately 12 rooms and suites. It can be proud of the excellent location in the quite and picturesque part of Florence, Oltrarno, on the high bank of the river. The Florence's most famous panoramic Piazzale Michaelangelo is next to the Villa, but the view from this place can't be compared to the breathtaking panorama from the hotel terrace. The hotel restaurant is a must point. It has a Michelin star and its chef is a prodigy indeed. The hotel's wine cellar is always not to be missed. But be ready to pick up a restaurant bill as impressive as the chef's talent.The hotel staff is friendly and helpful, they even managed to book us a tour around the Uffizi Gallery on the Easter's Eve! I do hope that once we'll come back to Villa La Vedetta.
Reviews.Author: AddictTraveller69

Reviews.Content: Loved the Villa la Vedetta This hotel is simply stunning. The friendly and genuine service offered by all the staff was outstanding. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel/chain to all.
Reviews.Author: RuthEdinburgh

Reviews.Content: Wonderful picturesque Honeymoon       Guest house
Reviews.Author: ladynred9

Reviews.Content: Can't beat the view       Our bathroom
Reviews.Author: K&KMidwesterners

Reviews.Content: Exceptional View!!!       hotel's pool
Reviews.Author: love2travel79

Reviews.Content: Excellent choice We have just returned from a great trip in Italy and had the chance to stay in this great hotel. What a surprise. We booked the hotel based on other reviews that we read and everything was even better than wat it was supposed to be. Even the weather was fantastic in Italy. It seems already spring! A special mention to the Onice Restaurant: what a place! Superb food, excellent service, cozy atmosphere, very romantic ambience. We had a lovely dinner and a great stay. Definetely will recommend this hotel to our friends.
Reviews.Author: frankghs

Reviews.Content: Impressive semplicity Having a few days off we decided to take a last minute trip to Florence which I had wanted to visit for the longest time. We booked Villa la Vedetta for 3 nights. The location is probably one of the biggest pro of the hotel: the large patio enjoys an incredible view and it becomes a very romantic place especially at sunset...We had reserved a suite with view and were very pleased with the room we were given: really stunning, immaculate and beautifully appointed, with a good sized marble bathroom and Jacuzzi tub. All the staff was exceptionally friendly. They booked the museum and train tickets for us, and suggested wonderful restaurants. Great experience... we will definitely go back to Florence and Villa la Vedetta again.
Reviews.Author: ssssshhh

Reviews.Content: Go for it! We stayed 3 nights in this wonderful place and actually don't have enough words to describe how wonderful it is..the staff is sooo kind and helpful..everyone smiling and trying to make your stay really memorable..and we must say that they did achieve in it..and to not mention the restaurant..one michlein star, and excellent service. they definetely deserve the star. I have been in several rated restaurants, but none of them is up to Onice. The reception staff is really kind will help you plan the day in Florence. Go for a walk in Boboli if you can. Try the sauna in the hotel after a walking day...can-t imagine!!!
Reviews.Author: Fuzz555

Reviews.Content: Wonderful, romantic and dreamy We spent four days in this most wonderful place... It was like walking into a bit of heaven.... The open, modern feel to this hotel is very calming and just the place for a honeymoon or quiet holiday. The breakfasts are outstanding, fresh juices, breads, eggs, porridge - in fact almost anything you would want. The pool, surrounded by greenery, includes a large jaccuzzi. Our rooms were wonderful and overlooked the whole of Florence. It is a good 15 minutes walk to the centre of town but there is a shuttle which is free and will take you to 5 minutes of there. We are going back and will continue to do so... What a find!
Reviews.Author: madamB

Reviews.Content: Charming  We found this hotel in the Relais  Chateaux web site and, as we were looking for a nice, charming and quiet location, we thought Villa la Vedetta would meet our requirements. We were not disappointed: the hotel has a wonderful panoramic position, in a quiet environment, yet it's pretty close to the center of town so it is easy to move around for sightseeing and shopping!The hotel has a really pleasant home feel to it, with the reception staff being particularly friendly and always smiling. As the taxi dropped us off by the entrance, a staff member was there to greet us and leed us to the front desk: very kind and welcoming!! As a nice surprise, we were upgrated to a suite with view (we didn't specifically request it, but we appreciated the extra for sure!!!).Having heard great things about their restaurant Onice, we were eager to eat there at least once and, again, we were not disappointed: the food was incredible, beautifully presented and with great service. Breakfast as well was excellent.Overall it was a very romantic and relaxing stay. We would definitely stay at this hotel next time we travel to Italy.
Reviews.Author: iloveitaly23

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and friendly staff! We stayed at Villa la Vedetta in mid-November as part of our honeymoon trip. You can never have a bad visit to Florence, but staying at the Villa made it an even better experience. The rooms were very clean and well-appointed and the hotel and grounds are beautiful and very well kept. Our room was not in the main house but across the driveway in an additional building- still very lovely and convenient to all of the amenities. The view from the back terrace and pool is one of the best in Florence- you simply cannot go wrong here!There were a number of nice things about the room- good size, nice amenities, a spectacular jacuzzi bath and free internet access through the television. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the car service to go down to the main part of Florence and the front desk handled our train reservations for the next leg of our trip. The staff had a good recommendation for each of our questions and always smiled and greeted us (often by name) when we saw them around the hotel.The only possible drawback is location- it is quite a bit of a walk to the city center and the return walk is up a large hill. The last time we were in Florence we stayed closer to city center and it was nice to be able to walk 5 minutes back to the hotel, but it is worth the 20 minute walk for the superior view and environment. Not nearly as touristy and more quiet and relaxed. We did not dine in the restaurant as it was a bit overpriced and we had many other places to try. I recommend an amazing enotecca near the hotel called Fuori Puorta- excellent food and extraordinary wine selection. It's a ten minute walk from the hotel- more local with very fresh ingredients and reasonable prices. We liked it so much we ate there two nights in a row!
Reviews.Author: pepperdc

Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay We booked the hotel after reading the reviews. We went in early october . The temperatures were just right at about 24 c with a gentle breeze and a blue sky.The hotel in in a secluded quiet position .It is small with only 16 bedrooms but has a position overlooking florence second to none. The walk down to florence is lovely and does not take long - or the hotel car will take you down. The patio at the hotel is wonderful with fantastic views. The bedroom also had a lovely view (ask for a room overlooking florence) . Service was excellent and the food of best quality and beautifully presented.The hotel had a real happy feel to it with all the staff appearing to be enjoying their jobsWe will be back
Reviews.Author: greatweekends

Reviews.Content: A Fantastic Experience       View of Second Villa (where we stayed)
Reviews.Author: tech_lawyer

Reviews.Content: Breathtaking Views!       Romantic Deluxe Room
Reviews.Author: attygirl

Reviews.Content: No complaints! The Manager and his staff have perfected the art of the Personal Touch. Knowing when to clean your room, when to chat and make sure all is ok while giving you privacy also. The suites are immaculate and all details are tended to. The facility is secure and safe and offers a view that is unbeatable. What we enjoyed so much about Villa La Vedetta was just the pure indulgence of relaxation in a small intimate setting even though only a few steps from the caotic centre of Florence. Evenings of a cocktail on the panoramic terrace watching the sunset, an evening swim just 30 seconds walk from your room in the pool. Deciding whether to stay in and eat in the villa (Onice restaurant is simply fantastic) or to go a short taxi ride for a meal in downtown Florence where you have an infinity of choices. The concierge know what they suggest. My wife, baby daughter of 3 months  I had the best time, we will be back thats for sure for more of the Personal Touch. When I checked out the receptionist asked us whether we would have any suggestions for them to improve the hotel: I didn't have a clou!! No complaints! That's what I said. Thanks to all the staff!
Reviews.Author: spinner654

Reviews.Content: Wonderful!!! We stayed 3 nights at Villa La Vedetta in Florence and we loved this special and unique hotel, the lovely atmosphere and the wonderful view of the city. The reception staff was very helpful and professional with us. We booked a double grand deluxe through the hotel website and they upgarded us in a luxurious suite: very spacious and equipped with 5 star amenities. We will certanly be back!!
Reviews.Author: Loredana70

Reviews.Content: The right choice We have just returned from a week at Villa La Vedetta, having decided to take our vacation there based on other reviews posted prior to some posted recently. The hotel and service were everything that was written about them and more. We actually do not agree with some reviews and don't understand them. We have a 3 month old baby and all the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make sure all our needs were catered for.We were looking for a quiet vacation, and Villa La Vedetta certainly fitted the bill.We also very much enjoyed Firenze itself. The many terrific places to eat or 'Restaurant Onice' were a pleasure. The pool at the Hotel is quiet and clean and great for a refreshing swim after a day around. A great time at a wonerful location and venueit's the right choice if you come to Florence
Reviews.Author: traveller1985673

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great views, but not without shortfalls Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights as part of my honeymoon. First impressions were great. The view is spectacular from the bar/terrace and also from the poolside. However, we arrived at the hotel early, at 12pm and were told by reception staff that check in was not until 2pm. This was fine and perfectly normal for many hotels. Our luggage was taken by the porter but we were just told to come back at 2pm and not offered a drink or snack menu. We waited in the seated area outside for a long while but again were not approached by the waiting staff. I found this level of service strange for a 5 star hotel. Service in the bar in general was sluggish and if anything, understaffed. I found this remarkable, especially since there were always more than enough staff at/behind the reception area. That said, when our room was ready for check in, the manager had provided a complimentary bottle of prosecco due to us being on our honeymoon, which was much appreciated, and a nice gesture.The rooms were nice although not exceptional. Granted, we stayed in a standard room rather than a suite. The tap for adjusting the water pressure in the shower came off in my hand when I turned it. Very surprising. After my wife had a bath, the stopper wouldn't release to let the water out, so I ended up having to wedge a coin against it to remove the stopper. I didn't complain about this because it was a minor gripe but surprising nonetheless for a hotel of this quality. Breakfast was great, the best we had on our travels in Italy. The pool and jacuzzi and general pool area are beautiful, and the main selling point of the hotel. There is a gym on the top floor of the hotel, but it is more like a home gym than anything professional. Very basic. The restaurant is Michelin star and prices are outlandish as you would expect. There are very limited eating options in the hotel if you don't want to spend massively.There are a couple of quite nice restauraunts nearby, but it takes away from the hotel if you feel compelled to leave because of prohibitive pricing. As it happens we were not even tempted to splash out on the Onice restaurant in the hotel because it seemed to have all the atmosphere of a morgue. The hotel is very near Piazza Michelangiolo, which is a lovely square overlooking Florence with amazing views of sunset behind the Ponte Vecchio and the city.Overall, I enjoyed the stay, mainly because of the views and surrounds, and because it was my honeymoon, but the hotel is definitely not without its faults.
Reviews.Author: NBRADY

Reviews.Content: Lost in Translation The shiny brochures of the Concerto hotel group, who own the villa, promise unique and unusual experiences when you stay at their hotels. And perhaps I should have paid more attention to the language of such a claim, which has somehow become lost in translation. At best, the villa is like a gorgeous meringue, offering the promise of sweet surprises, but delivering remarkably little substance and flavour. The staff range from sullen and unyielding to disturbingly smiley when there is a sniff of a manager around. Our request to move to a suite with a view of Florence (surely the whole reason you come to such a hotel?) was met with quiet indifference, and we were quickly made to feel like an inconvenience. Nevertheless, being cheerfully stubborn about the whole thing did result in a better suite with lovely balcony views over Florence. (Room No. 306 is the one to go for, by the way). Our request for a bottle of champagne in the room upon arrival was ignored, and so, in fact, was our do not disturb sign, with the maids quite determined to enter at a time convenient for them. But let's not go there.We did not venture into the city centre initially, preferring to enjoy the stunning swimming pool and jacuzzi. But there was a problem ... not enough sunbeds! Now, come on Villa La Vedetta! In a small, 18 room hotel, you could surely manage enough sunbeds for every guest? Space is not the issue! Some people even had to resort to lying on the grass between other sunbathers on a thin hotel towel. Others gave up and sat on the concrete steps. When you look at the pictures, do note how much room there is on the terrace, occupied by upright chairs. Managers should be aware that nobody seems to use these chairs because there is nothing up there! If you must have them, please relocate the restaurant up there and move it away from the small bar area. To get to the heart of the Problems La Vedetta I would like to use a practial example. On the second day of our holiday, we ordered a bottle of fizzy water in the pool bar area - it was over 90 degrees, and we were sunbathing. A bottle of still water arrived nearly 45 minutes later, following 3 reminders. The waitress was apologetic and obviously exhausted, as she had been serving lunch, drinks and even the outrageously over-priced breakfast that day. So where are all the other staff? Many people resorted to shouting, hello?, with one man uttering, Can anybody hear me? into the restaurant / bar area. Nobody could. So, I will ask his question more directly, and hopefully, more loudly on this website: Can anybody from the senior management team of the Concerto group hear me? If you can, please examine your staffing policy and training more carefully (do you have enough? Are you trying to cut corners?), provide a reasonably priced restaurant alongside your Michelin-starred one (we did eat here and found it stunning but slow, and not as good as the one at the Hotel Majestic in Rome that we visited afterwards), and for goodness sake, buy some more sunbeds. In essence, treat this beautiful hotel and its wonderful customers with the respect they deserve and stop providing a second rate service for first rate prices. At the moment, you put the negative emphasis on unusual and unique and it woefully translates into this language as, never again!
Reviews.Author: S.Rodgers

Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, lovely breakfast but overpriced food We arrived at this incredibly beautiful location via taxi. Although the hotel had indicated that a shuttle would pick us up from the station this service is no longer available! The room we were given overlooked Florence and the beautiful terrace and we were delighted with the welcome. We discovered quite quickly that extras were OVER THE TOP with regards price and realised that simply using the hotel as a pied a terre was the best option. (A bottle of water cost 6 euros!). It was easy to find lovely restaurants and trattorias within walking distance and the hotel's shuttle was available during 9.30 to 6.00 - most of the time - to drive us to the Ponte about 5 minutes away by car. The breakfasts were delicious and very substantial and the pools (one with Jacuzzi) were a brilliant temperature. A luxury hotel but not worth the 5 star rating although finding a hotel in the hills, with a swimming pool overlooking Florence is probably worth the money. Will be back most definitely!
Reviews.Author: madambutterfly

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Villa We stayed at Villa La Vedetta 2 nights after reading the reviews in Tripadvisor and in other web sites. We booked a Double Romantic Room and we was upgraded. We loved the comfortable room, the beautiful furniture and the colours, the Jacuzzi into the bathroom and the panoramic view on the private garden. The staff was very friendly and helpful for any our request (museum  tour reservations). We also ate in the michelin star onice restaurant on the first night. It was not cheap, but the food was great and service very specialWe would highly recommend this beautiful  romantic hotel in Florence, because you won't want to leave.
Reviews.Author: MiguelPer.

Reviews.Content: Very poor  We were looking forward to staying at this hotel after we looked at the many reviews on this site and others. However, we were very dissapointed by the whole experience due to the poor level of service and lack of cleanliness, for example there was dust and evidence of previous occupants all round the room with mildew in the bathroom.The restaurant was pricey, which wasn't really an issue if the food and atmosphere had been up to scratch. The views from the hotel are very special but to get a room with a view is a rareity.The hotel is quite convenient to the city centre but the walk after a few days is quite draining, especially in the heat. The hotel car isn't as regular as one would expect and taxi's become quite expensive. This is well worth considering because if you are not happy with the restaurant, as with us, the only alternative is then the city.Our advice would be to stay elsewhere as this hotel is over priced, under cleaned with poor service.
Reviews.Author: Smoothy

Reviews.Content: Here I felt like a queen During my stay in this hotel I really felt like a queen. When I arrived the receptionist are waiting in front of the hotel door to give me a family welcome. I've made my check in into a big and wonderful leaving room, extreme comfortable.I'll remember with great pleasure forever, my evening spent near by the swimming pool and the fabulous large room where I slept.I've been the great fortune to enjoy a dinner in the Onice restaurant, I tried flavour I'll never forget especially a dish they called homemade lasagnetta... really fantastic!While I'm writing this review I'm really sad, 'cause now I wish to come back there, in Villa La Vedetta.
Reviews.Author: Greenline

Reviews.Content: Dont say here We are currently staying at the Villa La Vedetta, which coincides with our wedding  honeymoon here in Florence and it has been somewhat tarnished by staying here. We chose the Villa based on worldwide reviews and its supposed reputation, but how dissapointed are we?The views are undoubtably the only selling point of the hotel. There is absolutely no ability to meet the expectation or needs of the guest, which we experienced by having to cancel our small wedding reception for six two days prior to the event, due to a simple miscommunication which could have been easily solved, but the hotel would only do so for a very large premium - which had never previously been advised, total disregard for the special occasion.The attitude and service of the senior members of staff are indifferent, inpersonal, amateur and totally unprofessional, which for an eighteen room luxury hotel is not to be expected.We would not recommend this hotel to any level of client and those wanting a friendly, efficient, extremely professional and caring service should, without a doubt, stay at the Villa La Massa - as they saved our wedding day and made it perfect at such short notice.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Find another hotel, view was wonderful though I arrived with two small children and was told that I needed to purchase a suite since there were three. I told them I didn't need a suite, but they insisted. 400 additional euros later, I saw the suite. THere was mildew all around the tub. The bed was dusty and I truly did not enjoy my stay. The staff was indifferent. It was difficult to find as well. I had a GPS locator and the street was missing. Although, it's right next to the statue David which was nice.
Reviews.Author: Julzieluv

Reviews.Content: By far and away... the best hotel we have ever stayed in...       View of the Bed-area in the room
Reviews.Author: breathenow

Reviews.Content: A little oasis in the middle of Florence This is an absolutely beautiful hotel and so glad we stayed there! Our room was really lovely - luckily we were upgraded to a suite but I think all the rooms would have been good. The suite was, as you'd expect, very large and spacious. Added features in the room included two computers with free internet access (though it was a bit hard to navigate) and also a lovely jacuzzi. The pool area was gorgeous - perfect for a quick dip after a hot day in Florence - and stunning views over Florence. However, as some people have pointed out, the hotel is located a little outside of the centre. I guess that's part of the appeal but nonetheless it is long walk to the hotel and up quite a steep hill (ok if you're fit - unlike me!). We were also caught out a bit because we weren't told that breakfast was extra and that cost another 30 euros for two of us per day. The breakfast was however yummy and much better than the bog-standard ones usually served! Despite these minor problems, it is a brilliant hotel and it made my stay in florence very memorable.
Reviews.Author: WalesTraveller

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel We stayed at this hotel from Jan 6th to 9th 2006 for our 11th anniversary and I have to say, this hotel is exactly what I would recommend for a special occasion. Arriving at Florence train station from Pisa, we took a taxi ride to the hotel and drove up a lovely tree filled avenue and pulled into the drive. Walking into the hotel took my breath away, lovely music playing and very original touches. The room itself was great with lovely french doors out to a balcony with stunning views over Florence. I have read the other reviews about the walking time to the centre and I tend to agree, but we did walk into and back from town on a number of occasions - it can be done and is pretty exhilerating. I can recomend a FANTASTIC mexican restaurant in the Santa Croce area (directly opposite the river from the hotel) called Tijuana's that serves the best chilli bowl ever. the only drawback to the hotel is that you have to pay 40 euros for breakfast and if I had known that before the first morning I would have ordered everything on the menu! If i go back to Florence again - I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: Coonometer

Reviews.Content: Luxury accomodation The hotel itself is pure luxury ,beautifully appointed rooms(all in different styles) with everything you could require,huge comfortable beds ,fabulous bathrooms,lots of hanging space ,tv,internet,et etc etc.The staff were all friendly and very helpfull nothing was to much trouble.The public areas are equally luxurious and being a small (20 rooms) hotel was always very restfull during our stay,this is a hotel with a view lovely vista of Florence from the terrace and some rooms,the one downside if you can call it thatis you are some way from the centre and although it can be walked its a taxi ride each way in reality ,but if you can afford to stay here then thats not a problem and again as with most of these hotels there are some bargains to be picked up at certain times of the year.If i have gripe with this hotel its the restaurant,in all the years i have used the Michelin guide i have never really disagreed with any of them ive been to that have been awarded stars,this has one * ,we used it twice on the first occasion a special menu for xmas day was almost ruined by the chefs attempt to be to clever (in my opinion)with multipal flavours,finishing with a dessert with 5 different very rich items that wasnt finished by ourselves or anyone else that i could see,complete overkill,on our second visit on a normal evening the menu had been so reduced as to farcical for a restaurant of this supposed standing,in any other situation ie nearer city centre i would have walked out and gone somewhere else ,as it was what was offered was very good,nonetheless unnaceptable.This should not in any way detract from the hotel itself wich really is special.
Reviews.Author: wiggiatlarge
